intro: Nicotiana tabacum var. graeca, commonly known as Greek tobacco, is a variant of the tobacco plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its ornamental value, featuring strikingly large, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an annual, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a parent species in the development of many cultivated tobacco varieties.
